   10773             : namespace {
   10774             :     //! Signals fatal error message to the run context
   10775           0 :     void reportFatal( char const * const message ) {
   10776           0 :         Catch::getCurrentContext().getResultCapture()->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
   10777           0 :     }
   10778             : 
   10779             :     //! Minimal size Catch2 needs for its own fatal error handling.
   10780             :     //! Picked anecdotally, so it might not be sufficient on all
   10781             :     //! platforms, and for all configurations.
   10782             :     constexpr std::size_t minStackSizeForErrors = 32 * 1024;
   10783             : } // end unnamed namespace
   10784             : 
   10785             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH || CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS
   10786             : 
   10787             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH )
   10788             : 
   10789             : namespace Catch {
   10790             : 
   10791             :     struct SignalDefs { DWORD id; const char* name; };
   10792             : 
   10793             :     // There is no 1-1 mapping between signals and windows exceptions.
   10794             :     // Windows can easily distinguish between SO and SigSegV,
   10795             :     // but SigInt, SigTerm, etc are handled differently.
   10796             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
   10797             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ILLEGAL_INSTRUCTION),  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
   10798             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_STACK_OVERFLOW), "SIGSEGV - Stack overflow" },
   10799             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION), "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
   10800             :         { static_cast<DWORD>(EXCEPTION_INT_DIVIDE_BY_ZERO), "Divide by zero error" },
   10801             :     };
   10802             : 
   10803             :     static LONG CALLBACK handleVectoredException(PEXCEPTION_POINTERS ExceptionInfo) {
   10804             :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
   10805             :             if (ExceptionInfo->ExceptionRecord->ExceptionCode == def.id) {
   10806             :                 reportFatal(def.name);
   10807             :             }
   10808             :         }
   10809             :         // If its not an exception we care about, pass it along.
   10810             :         // This stops us from eating debugger breaks etc.
   10811             :         return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
   10812             :     }
   10813             : 
   10814             :     // Since we do not support multiple instantiations, we put these
   10815             :     // into global variables and rely on cleaning them up in outlined
   10816             :     // constructors/destructors
   10817             :     static PVOID exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
   10818             : 
   10819             :     // For MSVC, we reserve part of the stack memory for handling
   10820             :     // memory overflow structured exception.
   10821             :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
   10822             :         ULONG guaranteeSize = static_cast<ULONG>(minStackSizeForErrors);
   10823             :         if (!SetThreadStackGuarantee(&guaranteeSize)) {
   10824             :             // We do not want to fully error out, because needing
   10825             :             // the stack reserve should be rare enough anyway.
   10826             :             Catch::cerr()
   10827             :                 << "Failed to reserve piece of stack."
   10828             :                 << " Stack overflows will not be reported successfully.";
   10829             :         }
   10830             :     }
   10831             : 
   10832             :     // We do not attempt to unset the stack guarantee, because
   10833             :     // Windows does not support lowering the stack size guarantee.
   10834             :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() = default;
   10835             : 
   10836             :     void FatalConditionHandler::engage_platform() {
   10837             :         // Register as first handler in current chain
   10838             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = AddVectoredExceptionHandler(1, handleVectoredException);
   10839             :         if (!exceptionHandlerHandle) {
   10840             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not register vectored exception handler");
   10841             :         }
   10842             :     }
   10843             : 
   10844             :     void FatalConditionHandler::disengage_platform() {
   10845             :         if (!RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler(exceptionHandlerHandle)) {
   10846             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not unregister vectored exception handler");
   10847             :         }
   10848             :         exceptionHandlerHandle = nullptr;
   10849             :     }
   10850             : 
   10851             : } // end namespace Catch
   10852             : 
   10853             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_WINDOWS_SEH
   10854             : 
   10855             : #if defined( CATCH_CONFIG_POSIX_SIGNALS )
   10856             : 
   10857             : #include <signal.h>
   10858             : 
   10859             : namespace Catch {
   10860             : 
   10861             :     struct SignalDefs {
   10862             :         int id;
   10863             :         const char* name;
   10864             :     };
   10865             : 
   10866             :     static SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
   10867             :         { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
   10868             :         { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
   10869             :         { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
   10870             :         { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
   10871             :         { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
   10872             :         { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
   10873             :     };
   10874             : 
   10875             : // Older GCCs trigger -Wmissing-field-initializers for T foo = {}
   10876             : // which is zero initialization, but not explicit. We want to avoid
   10877             : // that.
   10878             : #if defined(__GNUC__)
   10879             : #    pragma GCC diagnostic push
   10880             : #    pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wmissing-field-initializers"
   10881             : #endif
   10882             : 
   10883             :     static char* altStackMem = nullptr;
   10884             :     static std::size_t altStackSize = 0;
   10885             :     static stack_t oldSigStack{};
   10886             :     static struct sigaction oldSigActions[sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs)]{};
   10887             : 
   10888           1 :     static void restorePreviousSignalHandlers() {
   10889             :         // We set signal handlers back to the previous ones. Hopefully
   10890             :         // nobody overwrote them in the meantime, and doesn't expect
   10891             :         // their signal handlers to live past ours given that they
   10892             :         // installed them after ours..
   10893           7 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs) / sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
   10894           6 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &oldSigActions[i], nullptr);
   10895             :         }
   10896             :         // Return the old stack
   10897           1 :         sigaltstack(&oldSigStack, nullptr);
   10898           1 :     }
   10899             : 
   10900           0 :     static void handleSignal( int sig ) {
   10901           0 :         char const * name = "<unknown signal>";
   10902           0 :         for (auto const& def : signalDefs) {
   10903           0 :             if (sig == def.id) {
   10904           0 :                 name = def.name;
   10905           0 :                 break;
   10906             :             }
   10907             :         }
   10908             :         // We need to restore previous signal handlers and let them do
   10909             :         // their thing, so that the users can have the debugger break
   10910             :         // when a signal is raised, and so on.
   10911           0 :         restorePreviousSignalHandlers();
   10912           0 :         reportFatal( name );
   10913           0 :         raise( sig );
   10914           0 :     }
   10915             : 
   10916           1 :     FatalConditionHandler::FatalConditionHandler() {
   10917           1 :         assert(!altStackMem && "Cannot initialize POSIX signal handler when one already exists");
   10918           1 :         if (altStackSize == 0) {
   10919           1 :             altStackSize = std::max(static_cast<size_t>(SIGSTKSZ), minStackSizeForErrors);
   10920             :         }
   10921       32769 :         altStackMem = new char[altStackSize]();
   10922           1 :     }
   10923             : 
   10924           1 :     FatalConditionHandler::~FatalConditionHandler() {
   10925           1 :         delete[] altStackMem;
   10926             :         // We signal that another instance can be constructed by zeroing
   10927             :         // out the pointer.
   10928           1 :         altStackMem = nullptr;
   10929           1 :     }
   10930             : 
   10931           1 :     void FatalConditionHandler::engage_platform() {
   10932             :         stack_t sigStack;
   10933           1 :         sigStack.ss_sp = altStackMem;
   10934           1 :         sigStack.ss_size = altStackSize;
   10935           1 :         sigStack.ss_flags = 0;
   10936           1 :         sigaltstack(&sigStack, &oldSigStack);
   10937           1 :         struct sigaction sa = { };
   10938             : 
   10939           1 :         sa.sa_handler = handleSignal;
   10940           1 :         sa.sa_flags = SA_ONSTACK;
   10941           7 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i) {
   10942           6 :             sigaction(signalDefs[i].id, &sa, &oldSigActions[i]);
   10943             :         }
   10944           1 :     }
   10945             : 
   10946             : #if defined(__GNUC__)
   10947             : #    pragma GCC diagnostic pop
   10948             : #endif
   10949             : 
   10950           1 :     void FatalConditionHandler::disengage_platform() {
   10951           1 :         restorePreviousSignalHandlers();
   10952           1 :     }
   10953             : 
   10954             : } // end namespace Catch

   11250           0 :     std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
   11251           0 :         TestSpec const& testSpec = config.testSpec();
   11252           0 :         if( config.hasTestFilters() )
   11253           0 :             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
   11254             :         else {
   11255           0 :             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
   11256             :         }

   11258           0 :         auto matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );

   11261           0 :                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
   11262           0 :                 : Colour::None;
   11263           0 :             Colour colourGuard( colour );

   11269           0 :                 if( description.empty() )
   11270           0 :                     description = "(NO DESCRIPTION)";
   11271           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( description ).indent(4) << std::endl;
   11272           0 :             }
   11273           0 :             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
   11274           0 :                 Catch::cout() << Column( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString() ).indent( 6 ) << "\n";
   11275           0 :         }
   11276             : 
   11277           0 :         if( !config.hasTestFilters() )

   11481           0 :     int32_t convert(float f) {
   11482             :         static_assert(sizeof(float) == sizeof(int32_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");

   11484           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &f, sizeof(f));

   11486             :     }

   11488           0 :     int64_t convert(double d) {
   11489             :         static_assert(sizeof(double) == sizeof(int64_t), "Important ULP matcher assumption violated");
   11490             :         int64_t i;
   11491           0 :         std::memcpy(&i, &d, sizeof(d));
   11492           0 :         return i;
   11493             :     }
   11494             : 
   11495             :     template <typename FP>
   11496           0 :     bool almostEqualUlps(FP lhs, FP rhs, uint64_t maxUlpDiff) {
   11497             :         // Comparison with NaN should always be false.
   11498             :         // This way we can rule it out before getting into the ugly details
   11499           0 :         if (Catch::isnan(lhs) || Catch::isnan(rhs)) {
   11500           0 :             return false;
   11501             :         }
   11502             : 
   11503           0 :         auto lc = convert(lhs);
   11504           0 :         auto rc = convert(rhs);
   11505             : 
   11506           0 :         if ((lc < 0) != (rc < 0)) {
   11507             :             // Potentially we can have +0 and -0
   11508           0 :             return lhs == rhs;
   11509             :         }
   11510             : 
   11511             :         // static cast as a workaround for IBM XLC
   11512           0 :         auto ulpDiff = std::abs(static_cast<FP>(lc - rc));
   11513           0 :         return static_cast<uint64_t>(ulpDiff) <= maxUlpDiff;
   11514             :     }
   11515             : 
   11516             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER)
   11517             : 
   11518           0 :     float nextafter(float x, float y) {
   11519           0 :         return ::nextafterf(x, y);
   11520             :     }
   11521             : 
   11522           0 :     double nextafter(double x, double y) {
   11523           0 :         return ::nextafter(x, y);
   11524             :     }
   11525             : 
   11526             : #endif // ^^^ CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER ^^^
   11527             : 
   11528             : template <typename FP>
   11529           0 : FP step(FP start, FP direction, uint64_t steps) {
   11530           0 :     for (uint64_t i = 0; i < steps; ++i) {
   11531             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_GLOBAL_NEXTAFTER)
   11532           0 :         start = Catch::nextafter(start, direction);
   11533             : #else
   11534             :         start = std::nextafter(start, direction);
   11535             : #endif
   11536             :     }
   11537           0 :     return start;
   11538             : }
   11539             : 
   11540             : // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
   11541             : // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
   11542           0 : bool marginComparison(double lhs, double rhs, double margin) {
   11543           0 :     return (lhs + margin >= rhs) && (rhs + margin >= lhs);
   11544             : }
   11545             : 
   11546             : template <typename FloatingPoint>
   11547           0 : void write(std::ostream& out, FloatingPoint num) {
   11548           0 :     out << std::scientific
   11549           0 :         << std::setprecision(std::numeric_limits<FloatingPoint>::max_digits10 - 1)
   11550           0 :         << num;
   11551           0 : }
   11552             : 
   11553             : } // end anonymous namespace
   11554             : 
   11555             : namespace Matchers {

   11558             :     enum class FloatingPointKind : uint8_t {
   11559             :         Float,
   11560             :         Double
   11561             :     };
   11562             : 
   11563           0 :     WithinAbsMatcher::WithinAbsMatcher(double target, double margin)
   11564           0 :         :m_target{ target }, m_margin{ margin } {
   11565           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(margin >= 0, "Invalid margin: " << margin << '.'
   11566             :             << " Margin has to be non-negative.");
   11567           0 :     }
   11568             : 
   11569             :     // Performs equivalent check of std::fabs(lhs - rhs) <= margin
   11570             :     // But without the subtraction to allow for INFINITY in comparison
   11571           0 :     bool WithinAbsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
   11572           0 :         return (matchee + m_margin >= m_target) && (m_target + m_margin >= matchee);
   11573             :     }
   11574             : 
   11575           0 :     std::string WithinAbsMatcher::describe() const {
   11576           0 :         return "is within " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify(m_margin) + " of " + ::Catch::Detail::stringify(m_target);
   11577             :     }
   11578             : 
   11579           0 :     WithinUlpsMatcher::WithinUlpsMatcher(double target, uint64_t ulps, FloatingPointKind baseType)

   11581           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(m_type == FloatingPointKind::Double
   11582             :                    || m_ulps < (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)(),
   11583             :             "Provided ULP is impossibly large for a float comparison.");
   11584           0 :     }
   11585             : 
   11586             : #if defined(__clang__)
   11587             : #pragma clang diagnostic push
   11588             : // Clang <3.5 reports on the default branch in the switch below
   11589             : #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wunreachable-code"
   11590             : #endif
   11591             : 
   11592           0 :     bool WithinUlpsMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
   11593           0 :         switch (m_type) {
   11594           0 :         case FloatingPointKind::Float:
   11595           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<float>(static_cast<float>(matchee), static_cast<float>(m_target), m_ulps);
   11596           0 :         case FloatingPointKind::Double:
   11597           0 :             return almostEqualUlps<double>(matchee, m_target, m_ulps);
   11598           0 :         default:
   11599           0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown FloatingPointKind value" );
   11600             :         }
   11601             :     }
   11602             : 
   11603             : #if defined(__clang__)
   11604             : #pragma clang diagnostic pop
   11605             : #endif
   11606             : 
   11607           0 :     std::string WithinUlpsMatcher::describe() const {
   11608           0 :         std::stringstream ret;
   11609             : 
   11610           0 :         ret << "is within " << m_ulps << " ULPs of ";
   11611             : 
   11612           0 :         if (m_type == FloatingPointKind::Float) {
   11613           0 :             write(ret, static_cast<float>(m_target));
   11614           0 :             ret << 'f';
   11615             :         } else {
   11616           0 :             write(ret, m_target);
   11617             :         }
   11618             : 
   11619           0 :         ret << " ([";
   11620           0 :         if (m_type == FloatingPointKind::Double) {
   11621           0 :             write(ret, step(m_target, static_cast<double>(-INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11622           0 :             ret << ", ";
   11623           0 :             write(ret, step(m_target, static_cast<double>( INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11624             :         } else {
   11625             :             // We have to cast INFINITY to float because of MinGW, see #1782
   11626           0 :             write(ret, step(static_cast<float>(m_target), static_cast<float>(-INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11627           0 :             ret << ", ";
   11628           0 :             write(ret, step(static_cast<float>(m_target), static_cast<float>( INFINITY), m_ulps));
   11629             :         }
   11630           0 :         ret << "])";
   11631             : 
   11632           0 :         return ret.str();
   11633           0 :     }
   11634             : 
   11635           0 :     WithinRelMatcher::WithinRelMatcher(double target, double epsilon):
   11636           0 :         m_target(target),
   11637           0 :         m_epsilon(epsilon){
   11638           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(m_epsilon >= 0., "Relative comparison with epsilon <  0 does not make sense.");
   11639           0 :         CATCH_ENFORCE(m_epsilon  < 1., "Relative comparison with epsilon >= 1 does not make sense.");
   11640           0 :     }
   11641             : 
   11642           0 :     bool WithinRelMatcher::match(double const& matchee) const {
   11643           0 :         const auto relMargin = m_epsilon * (std::max)(std::fabs(matchee), std::fabs(m_target));
   11644           0 :         return marginComparison(matchee, m_target,
   11645           0 :                                 std::isinf(relMargin)? 0 : relMargin);
   11646             :     }
   11647             : 
   11648           0 :     std::string WithinRelMatcher::describe() const {
   11649           0 :         Catch::ReusableStringStream sstr;
   11650           0 :         sstr << "and " << m_target << " are within " << m_epsilon * 100. << "% of each other";
   11651           0 :         return sstr.str();
   11652           0 :     }
   11653             : 
   11654             : }// namespace Floating
   11655             : 
   11656           0 : Floating::WithinUlpsMatcher WithinULP(double target, uint64_t maxUlpDiff) {
   11657           0 :     return Floating::WithinUlpsMatcher(target, maxUlpDiff, Floating::FloatingPointKind::Double);
   11658             : }
   11659             : 
   11660           0 : Floating::WithinUlpsMatcher WithinULP(float target, uint64_t maxUlpDiff) {

   11711           0 :             return m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No
   11712             :                    ? toLower( str )

   11855           0 :     ScopedMessage::~ScopedMessage() {

   11857           0 :             getResultCapture().popScopedMessage(m_info);
   11858             :         }
   11859           0 :     }
   11860             : 
   11861           0 :     Capturer::Capturer( StringRef macroName, SourceLineInfo const& lineInfo, ResultWas::OfType resultType, StringRef names ) {
   11862           0 :         auto trimmed = [&] (size_t start, size_t end) {
   11863           0 :             while (names[start] == ',' || isspace(static_cast<unsigned char>(names[start]))) {
   11864           0 :                 ++start;
   11865             :             }
   11866           0 :             while (names[end] == ',' || isspace(static_cast<unsigned char>(names[end]))) {
   11867           0 :                 --end;
   11868             :             }
   11869           0 :             return names.substr(start, end - start + 1);
   11870           0 :         };
   11871           0 :         auto skipq = [&] (size_t start, char quote) {
   11872           0 :             for (auto i = start + 1; i < names.size() ; ++i) {
   11873           0 :                 if (names[i] == quote)
   11874           0 :                     return i;
   11875           0 :                 if (names[i] == '\\')
   11876           0 :                     ++i;
   11877             :             }
   11878           0 :             CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("CAPTURE parsing encountered unmatched quote");
   11879           0 :         };
   11880             : 
   11881           0 :         size_t start = 0;
   11882           0 :         std::stack<char> openings;
   11883           0 :         for (size_t pos = 0; pos < names.size(); ++pos) {
   11884           0 :             char c = names[pos];
   11885           0 :             switch (c) {
   11886           0 :             case '[':
   11887             :             case '{':
   11888             :             case '(':
   11889             :             // It is basically impossible to disambiguate between
   11890             :             // comparison and start of template args in this context
   11891             : //            case '<':
   11892           0 :                 openings.push(c);
   11893           0 :                 break;
   11894           0 :             case ']':
   11895             :             case '}':
   11896             :             case ')':
   11897             : //           case '>':
   11898           0 :                 openings.pop();
   11899           0 :                 break;
   11900           0 :             case '"':
   11901             :             case '\'':
   11902           0 :                 pos = skipq(pos, c);
   11903           0 :                 break;
   11904           0 :             case ',':
   11905           0 :                 if (start != pos && openings.empty()) {
   11906           0 :                     m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11907           0 :                     m_messages.back().message = static_cast<std::string>(trimmed(start, pos));
   11908           0 :                     m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11909           0 :                     start = pos;
   11910             :                 }
   11911             :             }
   11912             :         }
   11913           0 :         assert(openings.empty() && "Mismatched openings");
   11914           0 :         m_messages.emplace_back(macroName, lineInfo, resultType);
   11915           0 :         m_messages.back().message = static_cast<std::string>(trimmed(start, names.size() - 1));
   11916           0 :         m_messages.back().message += " := ";
   11917           0 :     }
   11918           0 :     Capturer::~Capturer() {
   11919           0 :         if ( !uncaught_exceptions() ){
   11920           0 :             assert( m_captured == m_messages.size() );
   11921           0 :             for( size_t i = 0; i < m_captured; ++i  )
   11922           0 :                 m_resultCapture.popScopedMessage( m_messages[i] );
   11923             :         }
   11924           0 :     }
   11925             : 
   11926           0 :     void Capturer::captureValue( size_t index, std::string const& value ) {
   11927           0 :         assert( index < m_messages.size() );
   11928           0 :         m_messages[index].message += value;
   11929           0 :         m_resultCapture.pushScopedMessage( m_messages[index] );
   11930           0 :         m_captured++;
   11931           0 :     }
   11932             : 
   11933             : } // end namespace Catch

   11964             : 
   11965             :     // StdErr has two constituent streams in C++, std::cerr and std::clog
   11966             :     // This means that we need to redirect 2 streams into 1 to keep proper
   11967             :     // order of writes
   11968             :     class RedirectedStdErr {
   11969             :         ReusableStringStream m_rss;
   11970             :         RedirectedStream m_cerr;
   11971             :         RedirectedStream m_clog;
   11972             :     public:
   11973             :         RedirectedStdErr();
   11974             :         auto str() const -> std::string;
   11975             :     };
   11976             :

   11981             :         RedirectedStreams(RedirectedStreams&&) = delete;

   11983             :

   11991             :     };
   11992             : 
   11993             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE)
   11994             : 
   11995             :     // Windows's implementation of std::tmpfile is terrible (it tries
   11996             :     // to create a file inside system folder, thus requiring elevated
   11997             :     // privileges for the binary), so we have to use tmpnam(_s) and
   11998             :     // create the file ourselves there.
   11999             :     class TempFile {
   12000             :     public:
   12001             :         TempFile(TempFile const&) = delete;
   12002             :         TempFile& operator=(TempFile const&) = delete;
   12003             :         TempFile(TempFile&&) = delete;
   12004             :         TempFile& operator=(TempFile&&) = delete;
   12005             : 
   12006             :         TempFile();
   12007             :         ~TempFile();
   12008             : 
   12009             :         std::FILE* getFile();
   12010             :         std::string getContents();
   12011             : 
   12012             :     private:
   12013             :         std::FILE* m_file = nullptr;
   12014             :     #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12015             :         char m_buffer[L_tmpnam] = { 0 };
   12016             :     #endif
   12017             :     };
   12018             : 
   12019             :     class OutputRedirect {
   12020             :     public:
   12021             :         OutputRedirect(OutputRedirect const&) = delete;
   12022             :         OutputRedirect& operator=(OutputRedirect const&) = delete;
   12023             :         OutputRedirect(OutputRedirect&&) = delete;
   12024             :         OutputRedirect& operator=(OutputRedirect&&) = delete;
   12025             : 
   12026             :         OutputRedirect(std::string& stdout_dest, std::string& stderr_dest);
   12027             :         ~OutputRedirect();
   12028             :

   12030             :         int m_originalStdout = -1;
   12031             :         int m_originalStderr = -1;

   12033             :         TempFile m_stderrFile;

   12035             :         std::string& m_stderrDest;
   12036             :     };
   12037             : 
   12038             : #endif

   12063           0 :     RedirectedStream::RedirectedStream( std::ostream& originalStream, std::ostream& redirectionStream )

   12065           0 :         m_redirectionStream( redirectionStream ),

   12069           0 :     }

   12071           0 :     RedirectedStream::~RedirectedStream() {
   12072           0 :         m_originalStream.rdbuf( m_prevBuf );
   12073           0 :     }
   12074             : 
   12075           0 :     RedirectedStdOut::RedirectedStdOut() : m_cout( Catch::cout(), m_rss.get() ) {}

   12077             : 
   12078           0 :     RedirectedStdErr::RedirectedStdErr()

   12087           0 :     {}
   12088             : 
   12089           0 :     RedirectedStreams::~RedirectedStreams() {
   12090           0 :         m_redirectedCout += m_redirectedStdOut.str();
   12091           0 :         m_redirectedCerr += m_redirectedStdErr.str();
   12092           0 :     }
   12093             : 
   12094             : #if defined(CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE)
   12095             : 
   12096             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12097             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
   12098             :         if (tmpnam_s(m_buffer)) {
   12099             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not get a temp filename");
   12100             :         }
   12101             :         if (fopen_s(&m_file, m_buffer, "w+")) {
   12102             :             char buffer[100];
   12103             :             if (strerror_s(buffer, errno)) {
   12104             :                 CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not translate errno to a string");
   12105             :             }
   12106             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not open the temp file: '" << m_buffer << "' because: " << buffer);
   12107             :         }
   12108             :     }
   12109             : #else
   12110             :     TempFile::TempFile() {
   12111             :         m_file = std::tmpfile();
   12112             :         if (!m_file) {
   12113             :             CATCH_RUNTIME_ERROR("Could not create a temp file.");
   12114             :         }
   12115             :     }
   12116             : 
   12117             : #endif
   12118             : 
   12119             :     TempFile::~TempFile() {
   12120             :          // TBD: What to do about errors here?
   12121             :          std::fclose(m_file);
   12122             :          // We manually create the file on Windows only, on Linux
   12123             :          // it will be autodeleted
   12124             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12125             :          std::remove(m_buffer);
   12126             : #endif
   12127             :     }
   12128             : 
   12129             :     FILE* TempFile::getFile() {
   12130             :         return m_file;
   12131             :     }
   12132             : 
   12133             :     std::string TempFile::getContents() {
   12134             :         std::stringstream sstr;
   12135             :         char buffer[100] = {};
   12136             :         std::rewind(m_file);
   12137             :         while (std::fgets(buffer, sizeof(buffer), m_file)) {
   12138             :             sstr << buffer;
   12139             :         }
   12140             :         return sstr.str();
   12141             :     }
   12142             : 
   12143             :     OutputRedirect::OutputRedirect(std::string& stdout_dest, std::string& stderr_dest) :
   12144             :         m_originalStdout(dup(1)),
   12145             :         m_originalStderr(dup(2)),
   12146             :         m_stdoutDest(stdout_dest),
   12147             :         m_stderrDest(stderr_dest) {
   12148             :         dup2(fileno(m_stdoutFile.getFile()), 1);
   12149             :         dup2(fileno(m_stderrFile.getFile()), 2);
   12150             :     }
   12151             : 
   12152             :     OutputRedirect::~OutputRedirect() {
   12153             :         Catch::cout() << std::flush;
   12154             :         fflush(stdout);
   12155             :         // Since we support overriding these streams, we flush cerr
   12156             :         // even though std::cerr is unbuffered
   12157             :         Catch::cerr() << std::flush;
   12158             :         Catch::clog() << std::flush;
   12159             :         fflush(stderr);
   12160             : 
   12161             :         dup2(m_originalStdout, 1);
   12162             :         dup2(m_originalStderr, 2);
   12163             : 
   12164             :         m_stdoutDest += m_stdoutFile.getContents();
   12165             :         m_stderrDest += m_stderrFile.getContents();
   12166             :     }
   12167             : 
   12168             : #endif // CATCH_CONFIG_NEW_CAPTURE
   12169             : 
   12170             : } // namespace Catch

   12207             : namespace Catch {
   12208             : 
   12209             : namespace {
   12210             : 
   12211             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12212             : #pragma warning(push)
   12213             : #pragma warning(disable:4146) // we negate uint32 during the rotate
   12214             : #endif
   12215             :         // Safe rotr implementation thanks to John Regehr
   12216           0 :         uint32_t rotate_right(uint32_t val, uint32_t count) {
   12217           0 :             const uint32_t mask = 31;
   12218           0 :             count &= mask;
   12219           0 :             return (val >> count) | (val << (-count & mask));
   12220             :         }
   12221             : 
   12222             : #if defined(_MSC_VER)
   12223             : #pragma warning(pop)
   12224             : #endif
   12225             : 
   12226             : }
   12227             : 
   12228           0 :     SimplePcg32::SimplePcg32(result_type seed_) {
   12229           0 :         seed(seed_);
   12230           0 :     }
   12231             : 
   12232           0 :     void SimplePcg32::seed(result_type seed_) {
   12233           0 :         m_state = 0;
   12234           0 :         (*this)();
   12235           0 :         m_state += seed_;
   12236           0 :         (*this)();
   12237           0 :     }
   12238             : 
   12239           0 :     void SimplePcg32::discard(uint64_t skip) {
   12240             :         // We could implement this to run in O(log n) steps, but this
   12241             :         // should suffice for our use case.
   12242           0 :         for (uint64_t s = 0; s < skip; ++s) {
   12243           0 :             static_cast<void>((*this)());
   12244             :         }
   12245           0 :     }
   12246             : 
   12247           0 :     SimplePcg32::result_type SimplePcg32::operator()() {
   12248             :         // prepare the output value
   12249           0 :         const uint32_t xorshifted = static_cast<uint32_t>(((m_state >> 18u) ^ m_state) >> 27u);
   12250           0 :         const auto output = rotate_right(xorshifted, m_state >> 59u);
   12251             : 
   12252             :         // advance state
   12253           0 :         m_state = m_state * 6364136223846793005ULL + s_inc;
   12254             : 
   12255           0 :         return output;
   12256             :     }
   12257             : 
   12258           0 :     bool operator==(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs) {
   12259           0 :         return lhs.m_state == rhs.m_state;
   12260             :     }
   12261             : 
   12262           0 :     bool operator!=(SimplePcg32 const& lhs, SimplePcg32 const& rhs) {
   12263           0 :         return lhs.m_state != rhs.m_state;
   12264             :     }
   12265             : }

   12419             :     template<typename SingletonImplT, typename InterfaceT = SingletonImplT, typename MutableInterfaceT = InterfaceT>
   12420             :     class Singleton : SingletonImplT, public ISingleton {
   12421             : 
   12422          10 :         static auto getInternal() -> Singleton* {
   12423             :             static Singleton* s_instance = nullptr;
   12424          10 :             if( !s_instance ) {
   12425           1 :                 s_instance = new Singleton;
   12426           1 :                 addSingleton( s_instance );
   12427             :             }
   12428          10 :             return s_instance;
   12429             :         }
   12430             : 
   12431             :     public:
   12432           5 :         static auto get() -> InterfaceT const& {
   12433           5 :             return *getInternal();
   12434             :         }
   12435           5 :         static auto getMutable() -> MutableInterfaceT& {
   12436           5 :             return *getInternal();
   12437             :         }

   12556           0 :     bool isOk( ResultWas::OfType resultType ) {
   12557           0 :         return ( resultType & ResultWas::FailureBit ) == 0;
   12558             :     }
   12559           0 :     bool isJustInfo( int flags ) {
   12560           0 :         return flags == ResultWas::Info;
   12561             :     }

   12564           0 :         return static_cast<ResultDisposition::Flags>( static_cast<int>( lhs ) | static_cast<int>( rhs ) );
   12565             :     }
   12566             : 
   12567           0 :     bool shouldContinueOnFailure( int flags )    { return ( flags & ResultDisposition::ContinueOnFailure ) != 0; }

   12572             : // start catch_run_context.cpp
   12573             : 
   12574             : #include <cassert>
   12575             : #include <algorithm>
   12576             : #include <sstream>
   12577             : 
   12578             : namespace Catch {
   12579             : 
   12580             :     namespace Generators {
   12581             :         struct GeneratorTracker : TestCaseTracking::TrackerBase, IGeneratorTracker {
   12582             :             GeneratorBasePtr m_generator;
   12583             : 
   12584           0 :             GeneratorTracker( TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent )
   12585           0 :             :   TrackerBase( nameAndLocation, ctx, parent )
   12586           0 :             {}
   12587             :             ~GeneratorTracker();
   12588             : 
   12589           0 :             static GeneratorTracker& acquire( TrackerContext& ctx, TestCaseTracking::NameAndLocation const& nameAndLocation ) {
   12590           0 :                 std::shared_ptr<GeneratorTracker> tracker;
   12591             : 
   12592           0 :                 ITracker& currentTracker = ctx.currentTracker();
   12593             :                 // Under specific circumstances, the generator we want
   12594             :                 // to acquire is also the current tracker. If this is
   12595             :                 // the case, we have to avoid looking through current
   12596             :                 // tracker's children, and instead return the current
   12597             :                 // tracker.
   12598             :                 // A case where this check is important is e.g.
   12599             :                 //     for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
   12600             :                 //         int n = GENERATE(1, 2);
   12601             :                 //     }
   12602             :                 //
   12603             :                 // without it, the code above creates 5 nested generators.
   12604           0 :                 if (currentTracker.nameAndLocation() == nameAndLocation) {
   12605           0 :                     auto thisTracker = currentTracker.parent().findChild(nameAndLocation);
   12606           0 :                     assert(thisTracker);
   12607           0 :                     assert(thisTracker->isGeneratorTracker());
   12608           0 :                     tracker = std::static_pointer_cast<GeneratorTracker>(thisTracker);
   12609           0 :                 } else if ( TestCaseTracking::ITrackerPtr childTracker = currentTracker.findChild( nameAndLocation ) ) {
   12610           0 :                     assert( childTracker );
   12611           0 :                     assert( childTracker->isGeneratorTracker() );
   12612           0 :                     tracker = std::static_pointer_cast<GeneratorTracker>( childTracker );
   12613             :                 } else {
   12614           0 :                     tracker = std::make_shared<GeneratorTracker>( nameAndLocation, ctx, &currentTracker );
   12615           0 :                     currentTracker.addChild( tracker );
   12616           0 :                 }
   12617             : 
   12618           0 :                 if( !tracker->isComplete() ) {
   12619           0 :                     tracker->open();
   12620             :                 }
   12621             : 
   12622           0 :                 return *tracker;
   12623           0 :             }
   12624             : 
   12625             :             // TrackerBase interface
   12626           0 :             bool isGeneratorTracker() const override { return true; }
   12627           0 :             auto hasGenerator() const -> bool override {
   12628           0 :                 return !!m_generator;
   12629             :             }
   12630           0 :             void close() override {
   12631           0 :                 TrackerBase::close();
   12632             :                 // If a generator has a child (it is followed by a section)
   12633             :                 // and none of its children have started, then we must wait
   12634             :                 // until later to start consuming its values.
   12635             :                 // This catches cases where `GENERATE` is placed between two
   12636             :                 // `SECTION`s.
   12637             :                 // **The check for m_children.empty cannot be removed**.
   12638             :                 // doing so would break `GENERATE` _not_ followed by `SECTION`s.
   12639           0 :                 const bool should_wait_for_child = [&]() {
   12640             :                     // No children -> nobody to wait for
   12641           0 :                     if ( m_children.empty() ) {
   12642           0 :                         return false;
   12643             :                     }
   12644             :                     // If at least one child started executing, don't wait
   12645           0 :                     if ( std::find_if(
   12646             :                              m_children.begin(),
   12647             :                              m_children.end(),
   12648           0 :                              []( TestCaseTracking::ITrackerPtr tracker ) {
   12649           0 :                                  return tracker->hasStarted();
   12650           0 :                              } ) != m_children.end() ) {
   12651           0 :                         return false;
   12652             :                     }
   12653             : 
   12654             :                     // No children have started. We need to check if they _can_
   12655             :                     // start, and thus we should wait for them, or they cannot
   12656             :                     // start (due to filters), and we shouldn't wait for them
   12657           0 :                     auto* parent = m_parent;
   12658             :                     // This is safe: there is always at least one section
   12659             :                     // tracker in a test case tracking tree
   12660           0 :                     while ( !parent->isSectionTracker() ) {
   12661           0 :                         parent = &( parent->parent() );
   12662             :                     }
   12663           0 :                     assert( parent &&
   12664             :                             "Missing root (test case) level section" );
   12665             : 
   12666           0 :                     auto const& parentSection =
   12667             :                         static_cast<SectionTracker&>( *parent );
   12668           0 :                     auto const& filters = parentSection.getFilters();
   12669             :                     // No filters -> no restrictions on running sections
   12670           0 :                     if ( filters.empty() ) {
   12671           0 :                         return true;
   12672             :                     }
   12673             : 
   12674           0 :                     for ( auto const& child : m_children ) {
   12675           0 :                         if ( child->isSectionTracker() &&
   12676           0 :                              std::find( filters.begin(),
   12677             :                                         filters.end(),
   12678           0 :                                         static_cast<SectionTracker&>( *child )
   12679           0 :                                             .trimmedName() ) !=
   12680           0 :                                  filters.end() ) {
   12681           0 :                             return true;
   12682             :                         }
   12683             :                     }
   12684           0 :                     return false;
   12685           0 :                 }();
   12686             : 
   12687             :                 // This check is a bit tricky, because m_generator->next()
   12688             :                 // has a side-effect, where it consumes generator's current
   12689             :                 // value, but we do not want to invoke the side-effect if
   12690             :                 // this generator is still waiting for any child to start.
   12691           0 :                 if ( should_wait_for_child ||
   12692           0 :                      ( m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully &&
   12693           0 :                        m_generator->next() ) ) {
   12694           0 :                     m_children.clear();
   12695           0 :                     m_runState = Executing;
   12696             :                 }
   12697           0 :             }
   12698             : 
   12699             :             // IGeneratorTracker interface
   12700           0 :             auto getGenerator() const -> GeneratorBasePtr const& override {
   12701           0 :                 return m_generator;
   12702             :             }
   12703           0 :             void setGenerator( GeneratorBasePtr&& generator ) override {
   12704           0 :                 m_generator = std::move( generator );
   12705           0 :             }
   12706             :         };
   12707           0 :         GeneratorTracker::~GeneratorTracker() {}

   12784           0 :     void RunContext::assertionEnded(AssertionResult const & result) {

   12791           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failedButOk++;
   12792             :             else
   12793           0 :                 m_totals.assertions.failed++;
   12794             :         }

   12796           0 :             m_lastAssertionPassed = true;
   12797             :         }

   12992           1 :                 timer.start();
   12993           1 :                 invokeActiveTestCase();
   12994             :             }

   13000             :             // are reported without translation at the point of origin.

   13303           1 :                 return createReporter(config->getReporterName(), config);

   13305             : 
   13306             :             // On older platforms, returning std::unique_ptr<ListeningReporter>
   13307             :             // when the return type is std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>
   13308             :             // doesn't compile without a std::move call. However, this causes
   13309             :             // a warning on newer platforms. Thus, we have to work around
   13310             :             // it a bit and downcast the pointer manually.
   13311           0 :             auto ret = std::unique_ptr<IStreamingReporter>(new ListeningReporter);

   13321             :         class TestGroup {
   13322             :         public:
   13323           1 :             explicit TestGroup(std::shared_ptr<Config> const& config)
   13324           1 :             : m_config{config}
   13325           1 :             , m_context{config, makeReporter(config)}
   13326             :             {
   13327           1 :                 auto const& allTestCases = getAllTestCasesSorted(*m_config);
   13328           1 :                 m_matches = m_config->testSpec().matchesByFilter(allTestCases, *m_config);
   13329           1 :                 auto const& invalidArgs = m_config->testSpec().getInvalidArgs();
   13330             : 
   13331           1 :                 if (m_matches.empty() && invalidArgs.empty()) {
   13332           2 :                     for (auto const& test : allTestCases)
   13333           1 :                         if (!test.isHidden())
   13334           1 :                             m_tests.emplace(&test);
   13335             :                 } else {
   13336           0 :                     for (auto const& match : m_matches)
   13337           0 :                         m_tests.insert(match.tests.begin(), match.tests.end());
   13338             :                 }
   13339           1 :             }
   13340             : 
   13341           1 :             Totals execute() {
   13342           1 :                 auto const& invalidArgs = m_config->testSpec().getInvalidArgs();

   13344           1 :                 m_context.testGroupStarting(m_config->name(), 1, 1);
   13345           2 :                 for (auto const& testCase : m_tests) {
   13346           1 :                     if (!m_context.aborting())
   13347           1 :                         totals += m_context.runTest(*testCase);
   13348             :                     else
   13349           0 :                         m_context.reporter().skipTest(*testCase);
   13350             :                 }
   13351             : 
   13352           1 :                 for (auto const& match : m_matches) {
   13353           0 :                     if (match.tests.empty()) {
   13354           0 :                         m_context.reporter().noMatchingTestCases(match.name);
   13355           0 :                         totals.error = -1;
   13356             :                     }
   13357             :                 }
   13358             : 
   13359           1 :                 if (!invalidArgs.empty()) {
   13360           0 :                     for (auto const& invalidArg: invalidArgs)
   13361           0 :                          m_context.reporter().reportInvalidArguments(invalidArg);
   13362             :                 }
   13363             : 
   13364           1 :                 m_context.testGroupEnded(m_config->name(), totals, 1, 1);
   13365           1 :                 return totals;
   13366             :             }
   13367             :

   13541           1 :             config(); // Force config to be constructed

   13543           1 :             seedRng( *m_config );

   13545           1 :             if( m_configData.filenamesAsTags )
   13546           0 :                 applyFilenamesAsTags( *m_config );
   13547             : 
   13548             :             // Handle list request
   13549           1 :             if( Option<std::size_t> listed = list( m_config ) )
   13550           1 :                 return static_cast<int>( *listed );
   13551             : 
   13552           1 :             TestGroup tests { m_config };
   13553           1 :             auto const totals = tests.execute();
   13554             : 
   13555           1 :             if( m_config->warnAboutNoTests() && totals.error == -1 )
   13556           0 :                 return 2;
   13557             : 
   13558             :             // Note that on unices only the lower 8 bits are usually used, clamping
   13559             :             // the return value to 255 prevents false negative when some multiple
   13560             :             // of 256 tests has failed
   13561           1 :             return (std::min) (MaxExitCode, (std::max) (totals.error, static_cast<int>(totals.assertions.failed)));

   13636             :     namespace Detail { namespace {
   13637             :         template<typename WriterF, std::size_t bufferSize=256>
   13638             :         class StreamBufImpl : public std::streambuf {
   13639             :             char data[bufferSize];
   13640             :             WriterF m_writer;
   13641             : 
   13642             :         public:
   13643           0 :             StreamBufImpl() {
   13644           0 :                 setp( data, data + sizeof(data) );
   13645           0 :             }
   13646             : 
   13647           0 :             ~StreamBufImpl() noexcept {
   13648           0 :                 StreamBufImpl::sync();
   13649           0 :             }
   13650             : 
   13651             :         private:
   13652           0 :             int overflow( int c ) override {
   13653           0 :                 sync();
   13654             : 
   13655           0 :                 if( c != EOF ) {
   13656           0 :                     if( pbase() == epptr() )
   13657           0 :                         m_writer( std::string( 1, static_cast<char>( c ) ) );
   13658             :                     else
   13659           0 :                         sputc( static_cast<char>( c ) );
   13660             :                 }
   13661           0 :                 return 0;
   13662             :             }
   13663             : 
   13664           0 :             int sync() override {
   13665           0 :                 if( pbase() != pptr() ) {
   13666           0 :                     m_writer( std::string( pbase(), static_cast<std::string::size_type>( pptr() - pbase() ) ) );
   13667           0 :                     setp( pbase(), epptr() );
   13668             :                 }
   13669           0 :                 return 0;
   13670             :             }
   13671             :         };
   13672             : 
   13673             :         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
   13674             : 
   13675             :         struct OutputDebugWriter {
   13676             : 
   13677           0 :             void operator()( std::string const&str ) {
   13678           0 :                 writeToDebugConsole( str );
   13679           0 :             }
   13680             :         };

   13732             : 
   13733           1 :     auto makeStream( StringRef const &filename ) -> IStream const* {
   13734           1 :         if( filename.empty() )
   13735           1 :             return new Detail::CoutStream();
   13736           0 :         else if( filename[0] == '%' ) {
   13737           0 :             if( filename == "%debug" )

   13841           0 :     StringRef trim(StringRef ref) {
   13842           0 :         const auto is_ws = [](char c) {
   13843           0 :             return c == ' ' || c == '\t' || c == '\n' || c == '\r';
   13844             :         };

   13854           0 :         bool replaced = false;

   14185             : namespace Catch {
   14186             : 
   14187             :     namespace {
   14188             :         struct TestHasher {
   14189             :             using hash_t = uint64_t;
   14190             : 
   14191           0 :             explicit TestHasher( hash_t hashSuffix ):
   14192           0 :                 m_hashSuffix{ hashSuffix } {}
   14193             : 
   14194           0 :             uint32_t operator()( TestCase const& t ) const {
   14195             :                 // FNV-1a hash with multiplication fold.
   14196           0 :                 const hash_t prime = 1099511628211u;
   14197           0 :                 hash_t hash = 14695981039346656037u;
   14198           0 :                 for ( const char c : t.name ) {
   14199           0 :                     hash ^= c;
   14200           0 :                     hash *= prime;
   14201             :                 }
   14202           0 :                 hash ^= m_hashSuffix;
   14203           0 :                 hash *= prime;
   14204           0 :                 const uint32_t low{ static_cast<uint32_t>( hash ) };
   14205           0 :                 const uint32_t high{ static_cast<uint32_t>( hash >> 32 ) };
   14206           0 :                 return low * high;
   14207             :             }
   14208             : 
   14209             :         private:
   14210             :             hash_t m_hashSuffix;
   14211             :         };
   14212             :     } // end unnamed namespace
   14213             : 
   14214           1 :     std::vector<TestCase> sortTests( IConfig const& config, std::vector<TestCase> const& unsortedTestCases ) {
   14215           1 :         switch( config.runOrder() ) {
   14216           1 :             case RunTests::InDeclarationOrder:
   14217             :                 // already in declaration order
   14218           1 :                 break;
   14219             : 
   14220           0 :             case RunTests::InLexicographicalOrder: {
   14221           0 :                 std::vector<TestCase> sorted = unsortedTestCases;
   14222           0 :                 std::sort( sorted.begin(), sorted.end() );
   14223           0 :                 return sorted;
   14224           0 :             }
   14225             : 
   14226           0 :             case RunTests::InRandomOrder: {
   14227           0 :                 seedRng( config );

   14722           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::visitChar( char c ) {

   14724           0 :             escape();
   14725           0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
   14726           0 :             return true;
   14727           0 :         }else if((m_mode != EscapedName) && (c == ',') )  {
   14728           0 :             return separate();
   14729             :         }
   14730             : 
   14731           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14732           0 :         case None:
   14733           0 :             if( processNoneChar( c ) )
   14734           0 :                 return true;
   14735           0 :             break;
   14736           0 :         case Name:
   14737           0 :             processNameChar( c );
   14738           0 :             break;
   14739           0 :         case EscapedName:
   14740           0 :             endMode();
   14741           0 :             addCharToPattern(c);
   14742           0 :             return true;
   14743           0 :         default:
   14744             :         case Tag:
   14745             :         case QuotedName:
   14746           0 :             if( processOtherChar( c ) )
   14747           0 :                 return true;
   14748           0 :             break;
   14749             :         }
   14750             : 
   14751           0 :         m_substring += c;
   14752           0 :         if( !isControlChar( c ) ) {
   14753           0 :             m_patternName += c;
   14754           0 :             m_realPatternPos++;
   14755             :         }
   14756           0 :         return true;
   14757             :     }
   14758             :     // Two of the processing methods return true to signal the caller to return
   14759             :     // without adding the given character to the current pattern strings
   14760           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processNoneChar( char c ) {
   14761           0 :         switch( c ) {
   14762           0 :         case ' ':
   14763           0 :             return true;
   14764           0 :         case '~':
   14765           0 :             m_exclusion = true;
   14766           0 :             return false;
   14767           0 :         case '[':
   14768           0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
   14769           0 :             return false;
   14770           0 :         case '"':
   14771           0 :             startNewMode( QuotedName );
   14772           0 :             return false;
   14773           0 :         default:
   14774           0 :             startNewMode( Name );
   14775           0 :             return false;
   14776             :         }
   14777             :     }
   14778           0 :     void TestSpecParser::processNameChar( char c ) {
   14779           0 :         if( c == '[' ) {
   14780           0 :             if( m_substring == "exclude:" )
   14781           0 :                 m_exclusion = true;
   14782             :             else
   14783           0 :                 endMode();
   14784           0 :             startNewMode( Tag );
   14785             :         }
   14786           0 :     }
   14787           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::processOtherChar( char c ) {
   14788           0 :         if( !isControlChar( c ) )
   14789           0 :             return false;
   14790           0 :         m_substring += c;
   14791           0 :         endMode();
   14792           0 :         return true;
   14793             :     }
   14794           0 :     void TestSpecParser::startNewMode( Mode mode ) {
   14795           0 :         m_mode = mode;
   14796           0 :     }
   14797           0 :     void TestSpecParser::endMode() {
   14798           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14799           0 :         case Name:
   14800             :         case QuotedName:
   14801           0 :             return addNamePattern();
   14802           0 :         case Tag:
   14803           0 :             return addTagPattern();
   14804           0 :         case EscapedName:
   14805           0 :             revertBackToLastMode();
   14806           0 :             return;
   14807           0 :         case None:
   14808             :         default:
   14809           0 :             return startNewMode( None );
   14810             :         }
   14811             :     }
   14812           0 :     void TestSpecParser::escape() {
   14813           0 :         saveLastMode();
   14814           0 :         m_mode = EscapedName;
   14815           0 :         m_escapeChars.push_back(m_realPatternPos);
   14816           0 :     }
   14817           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::isControlChar( char c ) const {
   14818           0 :         switch( m_mode ) {
   14819           0 :             default:
   14820           0 :                 return false;
   14821           0 :             case None:
   14822           0 :                 return c == '~';
   14823           0 :             case Name:
   14824           0 :                 return c == '[';
   14825           0 :             case EscapedName:
   14826           0 :                 return true;
   14827           0 :             case QuotedName:
   14828           0 :                 return c == '"';
   14829           0 :             case Tag:
   14830           0 :                 return c == '[' || c == ']';
   14831             :         }
   14832             :     }
   14833             : 
   14834           1 :     void TestSpecParser::addFilter() {
   14835           1 :         if( !m_currentFilter.m_patterns.empty() ) {
   14836           0 :             m_testSpec.m_filters.push_back( m_currentFilter );
   14837           0 :             m_currentFilter = TestSpec::Filter();
   14838             :         }
   14839           1 :     }
   14840             : 
   14841           0 :     void TestSpecParser::saveLastMode() {
   14842           0 :       lastMode = m_mode;
   14843           0 :     }
   14844             : 
   14845           0 :     void TestSpecParser::revertBackToLastMode() {
   14846           0 :       m_mode = lastMode;
   14847           0 :     }
   14848             : 
   14849           0 :     bool TestSpecParser::separate() {
   14850           0 :       if( (m_mode==QuotedName) || (m_mode==Tag) ){
   14851             :          //invalid argument, signal failure to previous scope.
   14852           0 :          m_mode = None;
   14853           0 :          m_pos = m_arg.size();
   14854           0 :          m_substring.clear();
   14855           0 :          m_patternName.clear();
   14856           0 :          m_realPatternPos = 0;
   14857           0 :          return false;
   14858             :       }
   14859           0 :       endMode();
   14860           0 :       addFilter();
   14861           0 :       return true; //success
   14862             :     }
   14863             : 
   14864           0 :     std::string TestSpecParser::preprocessPattern() {
   14865           0 :         std::string token = m_patternName;
   14866           0 :         for (std::size_t i = 0; i < m_escapeChars.size(); ++i)
   14867           0 :             token = token.substr(0, m_escapeChars[i] - i) + token.substr(m_escapeChars[i] - i + 1);
   14868           0 :         m_escapeChars.clear();
   14869           0 :         if (startsWith(token, "exclude:")) {
   14870           0 :             m_exclusion = true;
   14871           0 :             token = token.substr(8);
   14872             :         }
   14873             : 
   14874           0 :         m_patternName.clear();
   14875           0 :         m_realPatternPos = 0;
   14876             : 
   14877           0 :         return token;
   14878           0 :     }
   14879             : 
   14880           0 :     void TestSpecParser::addNamePattern() {
   14881           0 :         auto token = preprocessPattern();
   14882             : 
   14883           0 :         if (!token.empty()) {
   14884           0 :             TestSpec::PatternPtr pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::NamePattern>(token, m_substring);
   14885           0 :             if (m_exclusion)
   14886           0 :                 pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::ExcludedPattern>(pattern);
   14887           0 :             m_currentFilter.m_patterns.push_back(pattern);
   14888           0 :         }
   14889           0 :         m_substring.clear();
   14890           0 :         m_exclusion = false;
   14891           0 :         m_mode = None;
   14892           0 :     }
   14893             : 
   14894           0 :     void TestSpecParser::addTagPattern() {
   14895           0 :         auto token = preprocessPattern();
   14896             : 
   14897           0 :         if (!token.empty()) {
   14898             :             // If the tag pattern is the "hide and tag" shorthand (e.g. [.foo])
   14899             :             // we have to create a separate hide tag and shorten the real one
   14900           0 :             if (token.size() > 1 && token[0] == '.') {
   14901           0 :                 token.erase(token.begin());
   14902           0 :                 TestSpec::PatternPtr pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::TagPattern>(".", m_substring);
   14903           0 :                 if (m_exclusion) {
   14904           0 :                     pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::ExcludedPattern>(pattern);
   14905             :                 }
   14906           0 :                 m_currentFilter.m_patterns.push_back(pattern);
   14907           0 :             }
   14908             : 
   14909           0 :             TestSpec::PatternPtr pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::TagPattern>(token, m_substring);
   14910             : 
   14911           0 :             if (m_exclusion) {
   14912           0 :                 pattern = std::make_shared<TestSpec::ExcludedPattern>(pattern);
   14913             :             }
   14914           0 :             m_currentFilter.m_patterns.push_back(pattern);
   14915           0 :         }
   14916           0 :         m_substring.clear();
   14917           0 :         m_exclusion = false;
   14918           0 :         m_mode = None;
   14919           0 :     }
   14920             : 
   14921           0 :     TestSpec parseTestSpec( std::string const& arg ) {
   14922           0 :         return TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( arg ).testSpec();
   14923             :     }

   14929             : #include <chrono>
   14930             : 
   14931             : static const uint64_t nanosecondsInSecond = 1000000000;
   14932             : 
   14933             : namespace Catch {
   14934             : 
   14935           2 :     auto getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() -> uint64_t {
   14936           2 :         return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::nanoseconds>( std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch() ).count();
   14937             :     }
   14938             : 
   14939             :     namespace {
   14940           0 :         auto estimateClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14941           0 :             uint64_t sum = 0;
   14942             :             static const uint64_t iterations = 1000000;
   14943             : 
   14944           0 :             auto startTime = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14945             : 
   14946           0 :             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < iterations; ++i ) {
   14947             : 
   14948             :                 uint64_t ticks;
   14949           0 :                 uint64_t baseTicks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14950             :                 do {
   14951           0 :                     ticks = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14952           0 :                 } while( ticks == baseTicks );
   14953             : 
   14954           0 :                 auto delta = ticks - baseTicks;
   14955           0 :                 sum += delta;
   14956             : 
   14957             :                 // If we have been calibrating for over 3 seconds -- the clock
   14958             :                 // is terrible and we should move on.
   14959             :                 // TBD: How to signal that the measured resolution is probably wrong?
   14960           0 :                 if (ticks > startTime + 3 * nanosecondsInSecond) {
   14961           0 :                     return sum / ( i + 1u );
   14962             :                 }
   14963             :             }
   14964             : 
   14965             :             // We're just taking the mean, here. To do better we could take the std. dev and exclude outliers
   14966             :             // - and potentially do more iterations if there's a high variance.
   14967           0 :             return sum/iterations;
   14968             :         }
   14969             :     }
   14970           0 :     auto getEstimatedClockResolution() -> uint64_t {
   14971           0 :         static auto s_resolution = estimateClockResolution();
   14972           0 :         return s_resolution;
   14973             :     }
   14974             : 
   14975           1 :     void Timer::start() {
   14976           1 :        m_nanoseconds = getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch();
   14977           1 :     }
   14978           1 :     auto Timer::getElapsedNanoseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14979           1 :         return getCurrentNanosecondsSinceEpoch() - m_nanoseconds;
   14980             :     }
   14981           1 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMicroseconds() const -> uint64_t {
   14982           1 :         return getElapsedNanoseconds()/1000;
   14983             :     }
   14984           0 :     auto Timer::getElapsedMilliseconds() const -> unsigned int {
   14985           0 :         return static_cast<unsigned int>(getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000);
   14986             :     }
   14987           1 :     auto Timer::getElapsedSeconds() const -> double {
   14988           1 :         return getElapsedMicroseconds()/1000000.0;
   14989             :     }
   14990             : 
   14991             : } // namespace Catch

   15018             :         struct Endianness {
   15019             :             enum Arch { Big, Little };
   15020             : 
   15021           0 :             static Arch which() {
   15022           0 :                 int one = 1;
   15023             :                 // If the lowest byte we read is non-zero, we can assume
   15024             :                 // that little endian format is used.
   15025           0 :                 auto value = *reinterpret_cast<char*>(&one);
   15026           0 :                 return value ? Little : Big;
   15027             :             }
   15028             :         };
   15029             :     }

   15031           0 :     std::string rawMemoryToString( const void *object, std::size_t size ) {
   15032             :         // Reverse order for little endian architectures
   15033           0 :         int i = 0, end = static_cast<int>( size ), inc = 1;
   15034           0 :         if( Endianness::which() == Endianness::Little ) {
   15035           0 :             i = end-1;
   15036           0 :             end = inc = -1;
   15037             :         }
   15038             : 
   15039           0 :         unsigned char const *bytes = static_cast<unsigned char const *>(object);
   15040           0 :         ReusableStringStream rss;
   15041           0 :         rss << "0x" << std::setfill('0') << std::hex;
   15042           0 :         for( ; i != end; i += inc )
   15043           0 :              rss << std::setw(2) << static_cast<unsigned>(bytes[i]);
   15044           0 :        return rss.str();
   15045           0 :     }
   15046             : }
   15047             : 
   15048             : template<typename T>
   15049           0 : std::string fpToString( T value, int precision ) {
   15050           0 :     if (Catch::isnan(value)) {
   15051           0 :         return "nan";
   15052             :     }
   15053             : 
   15054           0 :     ReusableStringStream rss;
   15055           0 :     rss << std::setprecision( precision )
   15056           0 :         << std::fixed
   15057           0 :         << value;
   15058           0 :     std::string d = rss.str();
   15059           0 :     std::size_t i = d.find_last_not_of( '0' );
   15060           0 :     if( i != std::string::npos && i != d.size()-1 ) {
   15061           0 :         if( d[i] == '.' )
   15062           0 :             i++;
   15063           0 :         d = d.substr( 0, i+1 );
   15064             :     }
   15065           0 :     return d;
