   15248             : 
   15249           3 :     Counts Counts::operator - ( Counts const& other ) const {
   15250           3 :         Counts diff;
   15251           3 :         diff.passed = passed - other.passed;
   15252           3 :         diff.failed = failed - other.failed;
   15253           3 :         diff.failedButOk = failedButOk - other.failedButOk;
   15254           3 :         return diff;
   15255             :     }
   15256             : 
   15257           3 :     Counts& Counts::operator += ( Counts const& other ) {
   15258           3 :         passed += other.passed;
   15259           3 :         failed += other.failed;
   15260           3 :         failedButOk += other.failedButOk;
   15261           3 :         return *this;
   15262             :     }
   15263             : 
   15264           7 :     std::size_t Counts::total() const {
   15265           7 :         return passed + failed + failedButOk;
   15266             :     }
   15267           2 :     bool Counts::allPassed() const {
   15268           2 :         return failed == 0 && failedButOk == 0;
   15269             :     }
   15270           0 :     bool Counts::allOk() const {
   15271           0 :         return failed == 0;
   15272             :     }
   15273             : 
   15274           1 :     Totals Totals::operator - ( Totals const& other ) const {
   15275           1 :         Totals diff;
   15276           1 :         diff.assertions = assertions - other.assertions;
   15277           1 :         diff.testCases = testCases - other.testCases;
   15278           1 :         return diff;
   15279             :     }
   15280             : 
   15281           1 :     Totals& Totals::operator += ( Totals const& other ) {
   15282           1 :         assertions += other.assertions;
   15283           1 :         testCases += other.testCases;
   15284           1 :         return *this;
   15285             :     }
   15286             : 
   15287           1 :     Totals Totals::delta( Totals const& prevTotals ) const {
   15288           1 :         Totals diff = *this - prevTotals;
   15289           1 :         if( diff.assertions.failed > 0 )
   15290           0 :             ++diff.testCases.failed;
   15291           1 :         else if( diff.assertions.failedButOk > 0 )
   15292           0 :             ++diff.testCases.failedButOk;
   15293             :         else
   15294           1 :             ++diff.testCases.passed;
   15295           1 :         return diff;
   15296             :     }
   15297             : 
   15298             : }

   15393           0 :     WildcardPattern::WildcardPattern( std::string const& pattern,
   15394           0 :                                       CaseSensitive::Choice caseSensitivity )
   15395           0 :     :   m_caseSensitivity( caseSensitivity ),
   15396           0 :         m_pattern( normaliseString( pattern ) )
   15397             :     {
   15398           0 :         if( startsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   15399           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 1 );
   15400           0 :             m_wildcard = WildcardAtStart;
   15401             :         }
   15402           0 :         if( endsWith( m_pattern, '*' ) ) {
   15403           0 :             m_pattern = m_pattern.substr( 0, m_pattern.size()-1 );
   15404           0 :             m_wildcard = static_cast<WildcardPosition>( m_wildcard | WildcardAtEnd );
   15405             :         }
   15406           0 :     }
   15407             : 
   15408           0 :     bool WildcardPattern::matches( std::string const& str ) const {
   15409           0 :         switch( m_wildcard ) {
   15410           0 :             case NoWildcard:
   15411           0 :                 return m_pattern == normaliseString( str );
   15412           0 :             case WildcardAtStart:
   15413           0 :                 return endsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15414           0 :             case WildcardAtEnd:
   15415           0 :                 return startsWith( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15416           0 :             case WildcardAtBothEnds:
   15417           0 :                 return contains( normaliseString( str ), m_pattern );
   15418           0 :             default:
   15419           0 :                 CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR( "Unknown enum" );
   15420             :         }
   15421             :     }
   15422             : 
   15423           0 :     std::string WildcardPattern::normaliseString( std::string const& str ) const {
   15424           0 :         return trim( m_caseSensitivity == CaseSensitive::No ? toLower( str ) : str );
   15425             :     }
   15426             : }
   15427             : // end catch_wildcard_pattern.cpp

   15437           0 :     size_t trailingBytes(unsigned char c) {
   15438           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   15439           0 :             return 2;
   15440             :         }
   15441           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   15442           0 :             return 3;
   15443             :         }
   15444           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   15445           0 :             return 4;
   15446             :         }
   15447           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   15448             :     }
   15449             : 
   15450           0 :     uint32_t headerValue(unsigned char c) {
   15451           0 :         if ((c & 0xE0) == 0xC0) {
   15452           0 :             return c & 0x1F;
   15453             :         }
   15454           0 :         if ((c & 0xF0) == 0xE0) {
   15455           0 :             return c & 0x0F;
   15456             :         }
   15457           0 :         if ((c & 0xF8) == 0xF0) {
   15458           0 :             return c & 0x07;
   15459             :         }
   15460           0 :         CATCH_INTERNAL_ERROR("Invalid multibyte utf-8 start byte encountered");
   15461             :     }
   15462             : 
   15463           0 :     void hexEscapeChar(std::ostream& os, unsigned char c) {
   15464           0 :         std::ios_base::fmtflags f(os.flags());
   15465           0 :         os << "\\x"
   15466           0 :             << std::uppercase << std::hex << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(2)
   15467           0 :             << static_cast<int>(c);
   15468           0 :         os.flags(f);
   15469           0 :     }
   15470             : 
   15471           0 :     bool shouldNewline(XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15472           0 :         return !!(static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(fmt & XmlFormatting::Newline));
   15473             :     }
   15474             : 
   15475           0 :     bool shouldIndent(XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15476           0 :         return !!(static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(fmt & XmlFormatting::Indent));
   15477             :     }
   15478             : 
   15479             : } // anonymous namespace
   15480             : 
   15481           0 :     XmlFormatting operator | (XmlFormatting lhs, XmlFormatting rhs) {
   15482             :         return static_cast<XmlFormatting>(
   15483             :             static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(lhs) |
   15484             :             static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(rhs)
   15485           0 :         );
   15486             :     }

   15489             :         return static_cast<XmlFormatting>(
   15490             :             static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(lhs) &
   15491             :             static_cast<std::underlying_type<XmlFormatting>::type>(rhs)

   15494             : 
   15495           0 :     XmlEncode::XmlEncode( std::string const& str, ForWhat forWhat )
   15496           0 :     :   m_str( str ),
   15497           0 :         m_forWhat( forWhat )
   15498           0 :     {}
   15499             : 
   15500           0 :     void XmlEncode::encodeTo( std::ostream& os ) const {
   15501             :         // Apostrophe escaping not necessary if we always use " to write attributes
   15502             :         // (see: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax)
   15503             : 
   15504           0 :         for( std::size_t idx = 0; idx < m_str.size(); ++ idx ) {
   15505           0 :             unsigned char c = m_str[idx];
   15506           0 :             switch (c) {
   15507           0 :             case '<':   os << "&lt;"; break;
   15508           0 :             case '&':   os << "&amp;"; break;
   15509             : 
   15510           0 :             case '>':
   15511             :                 // See: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/#syntax
   15512           0 :                 if (idx > 2 && m_str[idx - 1] == ']' && m_str[idx - 2] == ']')
   15513           0 :                     os << "&gt;";
   15514             :                 else
   15515           0 :                     os << c;
   15516           0 :                 break;
   15517             : 
   15518           0 :             case '\"':
   15519           0 :                 if (m_forWhat == ForAttributes)
   15520           0 :                     os << "&quot;";
   15521             :                 else
   15522           0 :                     os << c;
   15523           0 :                 break;
   15524             : 
   15525           0 :             default:
   15526             :                 // Check for control characters and invalid utf-8
   15527             : 
   15528             :                 // Escape control characters in standard ascii
   15529             :                 // see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/404107/why-are-control-characters-illegal-in-xml-1-0
   15530           0 :                 if (c < 0x09 || (c > 0x0D && c < 0x20) || c == 0x7F) {
   15531           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15532           0 :                     break;
   15533             :                 }
   15534             : 
   15535             :                 // Plain ASCII: Write it to stream
   15536           0 :                 if (c < 0x7F) {
   15537           0 :                     os << c;
   15538           0 :                     break;
   15539             :                 }
   15540             : 
   15541             :                 // UTF-8 territory
   15542             :                 // Check if the encoding is valid and if it is not, hex escape bytes.
   15543             :                 // Important: We do not check the exact decoded values for validity, only the encoding format
   15544             :                 // First check that this bytes is a valid lead byte:
   15545             :                 // This means that it is not encoded as 1111 1XXX
   15546             :                 // Or as 10XX XXXX
   15547           0 :                 if (c <  0xC0 ||
   15548             :                     c >= 0xF8) {
   15549           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15550           0 :                     break;
   15551             :                 }
   15552             : 
   15553           0 :                 auto encBytes = trailingBytes(c);
   15554             :                 // Are there enough bytes left to avoid accessing out-of-bounds memory?
   15555           0 :                 if (idx + encBytes - 1 >= m_str.size()) {
   15556           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15557           0 :                     break;
   15558             :                 }
   15559             :                 // The header is valid, check data
   15560             :                 // The next encBytes bytes must together be a valid utf-8
   15561             :                 // This means: bitpattern 10XX XXXX and the extracted value is sane (ish)
   15562           0 :                 bool valid = true;
   15563           0 :                 uint32_t value = headerValue(c);
   15564           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 1; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   15565           0 :                     unsigned char nc = m_str[idx + n];
   15566           0 :                     valid &= ((nc & 0xC0) == 0x80);
   15567           0 :                     value = (value << 6) | (nc & 0x3F);
   15568             :                 }
   15569             : 
   15570           0 :                 if (
   15571             :                     // Wrong bit pattern of following bytes
   15572           0 :                     (!valid) ||
   15573             :                     // Overlong encodings
   15574           0 :                     (value < 0x80) ||
   15575           0 :                     (0x80 <= value && value < 0x800   && encBytes > 2) ||
   15576           0 :                     (0x800 < value && value < 0x10000 && encBytes > 3) ||
   15577             :                     // Encoded value out of range
   15578             :                     (value >= 0x110000)
   15579             :                     ) {
   15580           0 :                     hexEscapeChar(os, c);
   15581           0 :                     break;
   15582             :                 }
   15583             : 
   15584             :                 // If we got here, this is in fact a valid(ish) utf-8 sequence
   15585           0 :                 for (std::size_t n = 0; n < encBytes; ++n) {
   15586           0 :                     os << m_str[idx + n];
   15587             :                 }
   15588           0 :                 idx += encBytes - 1;
   15589           0 :                 break;
   15590             :             }
   15591             :         }
   15592           0 :     }
   15593             : 
   15594           0 :     std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, XmlEncode const& xmlEncode ) {
   15595           0 :         xmlEncode.encodeTo( os );
   15596           0 :         return os;
   15597             :     }
   15598             :

   15638           0 :     XmlWriter::~XmlWriter() {
   15639           0 :         while (!m_tags.empty()) {
   15640           0 :             endElement();
   15641             :         }
   15642           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   15643           0 :     }
   15644             : 
   15645           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::startElement( std::string const& name, XmlFormatting fmt ) {
   15646           0 :         ensureTagClosed();
   15647           0 :         newlineIfNecessary();
   15648           0 :         if (shouldIndent(fmt)) {
   15649           0 :             m_os << m_indent;
   15650           0 :             m_indent += "  ";
   15651             :         }
   15652           0 :         m_os << '<' << name;
   15653           0 :         m_tags.push_back( name );
   15654           0 :         m_tagIsOpen = true;
   15655           0 :         applyFormatting(fmt);
   15656           0 :         return *this;
   15657             :     }
   15658             : 
   15659           0 :     XmlWriter::ScopedElement XmlWriter::scopedElement( std::string const& name, XmlFormatting fmt ) {
   15660           0 :         ScopedElement scoped( this, fmt );
   15661           0 :         startElement( name, fmt );
   15662           0 :         return scoped;
   15663           0 :     }
   15664             : 
   15665           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::endElement(XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15666           0 :         m_indent = m_indent.substr(0, m_indent.size() - 2);
   15667             : 
   15668           0 :         if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   15669           0 :             m_os << "/>";
   15670           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   15671             :         } else {
   15672           0 :             newlineIfNecessary();
   15673           0 :             if (shouldIndent(fmt)) {
   15674           0 :                 m_os << m_indent;
   15675             :             }
   15676           0 :             m_os << "</" << m_tags.back() << ">";
   15677             :         }
   15678           0 :         m_os << std::flush;
   15679           0 :         applyFormatting(fmt);
   15680           0 :         m_tags.pop_back();
   15681           0 :         return *this;
   15682             :     }
   15683             : 
   15684           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, std::string const& attribute ) {
   15685           0 :         if( !name.empty() && !attribute.empty() )
   15686           0 :             m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << XmlEncode( attribute, XmlEncode::ForAttributes ) << '"';
   15687           0 :         return *this;

   15689             : 
   15690           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeAttribute( std::string const& name, bool attribute ) {
   15691           0 :         m_os << ' ' << name << "=\"" << ( attribute ? "true" : "false" ) << '"';
   15692           0 :         return *this;
   15693             :     }
   15694             : 
   15695           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeText( std::string const& text, XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15696           0 :         if( !text.empty() ){
   15697           0 :             bool tagWasOpen = m_tagIsOpen;
   15698           0 :             ensureTagClosed();
   15699           0 :             if (tagWasOpen && shouldIndent(fmt)) {
   15700           0 :                 m_os << m_indent;
   15701             :             }
   15702           0 :             m_os << XmlEncode( text );
   15703           0 :             applyFormatting(fmt);
   15704             :         }
   15705           0 :         return *this;
   15706             :     }
   15707             : 
   15708           0 :     XmlWriter& XmlWriter::writeComment( std::string const& text, XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15709           0 :         ensureTagClosed();
   15710           0 :         if (shouldIndent(fmt)) {
   15711           0 :             m_os << m_indent;
   15712             :         }
   15713           0 :         m_os << "<!--" << text << "-->";
   15714           0 :         applyFormatting(fmt);
   15715           0 :         return *this;

   15728           0 :     void XmlWriter::ensureTagClosed() {
   15729           0 :         if( m_tagIsOpen ) {
   15730           0 :             m_os << '>' << std::flush;
   15731           0 :             newlineIfNecessary();
   15732           0 :             m_tagIsOpen = false;
   15733             :         }
   15734           0 :     }
   15735             : 
   15736           0 :     void XmlWriter::applyFormatting(XmlFormatting fmt) {
   15737           0 :         m_needsNewline = shouldNewline(fmt);

   15739             : 
   15740           0 :     void XmlWriter::writeDeclaration() {
   15741           0 :         m_os << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
   15742           0 :     }
   15743             : 
   15744           0 :     void XmlWriter::newlineIfNecessary() {
   15745           0 :         if( m_needsNewline ) {
   15746           0 :             m_os << std::endl;
   15747           0 :             m_needsNewline = false;
   15748             :         }
   15749           0 :     }
   15750             : }

   15753             : 
   15754             : #include <cstring>

   15759             : 
   15760             : namespace Catch {
   15761           0 :     void prepareExpandedExpression(AssertionResult& result) {
   15762           0 :         result.getExpandedExpression();
   15763           0 :     }
   15764             : 
   15765             :     // Because formatting using c++ streams is stateful, drop down to C is required
   15766             :     // Alternatively we could use stringstream, but its performance is... not good.
   15767           0 :     std::string getFormattedDuration( double duration ) {
   15768             :         // Max exponent + 1 is required to represent the whole part
   15769             :         // + 1 for decimal point
   15770             :         // + 3 for the 3 decimal places
   15771             :         // + 1 for null terminator
   15772           0 :         const std::size_t maxDoubleSize = DBL_MAX_10_EXP + 1 + 1 + 3 + 1;
   15773             :         char buffer[maxDoubleSize];
   15774             : 
   15775             :         // Save previous errno, to prevent sprintf from overwriting it
   15776           0 :         ErrnoGuard guard;
   15777             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   15778             :         sprintf_s(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   15779             : #else
   15780           0 :         std::sprintf(buffer, "%.3f", duration);
   15781             : #endif
   15782           0 :         return std::string(buffer);
   15783           0 :     }
   15784             : 
   15785           1 :     bool shouldShowDuration( IConfig const& config, double duration ) {
   15786           1 :         if ( config.showDurations() == ShowDurations::Always ) {
   15787           0 :             return true;
   15788             :         }
   15789           1 :         if ( config.showDurations() == ShowDurations::Never ) {
   15790           0 :             return false;
   15791             :         }
   15792           1 :         const double min = config.minDuration();
   15793           1 :         return min >= 0 && duration >= min;
   15794             :     }

   15848             : namespace Catch {
   15849             : namespace {
   15850             : // Colour, message variants:
   15851             : // - white: No tests ran.
   15852             : // -   red: Failed [both/all] N test cases, failed [both/all] M assertions.
   15853             : // - white: Passed [both/all] N test cases (no assertions).
   15854             : // -   red: Failed N tests cases, failed M assertions.
   15855             : // - green: Passed [both/all] N tests cases with M assertions.
   15856           0 : void printTotals(std::ostream& out, const Totals& totals) {
   15857           0 :     if (totals.testCases.total() == 0) {
   15858           0 :         out << "No tests ran.";
   15859           0 :     } else if (totals.testCases.failed == totals.testCases.total()) {
   15860           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15861             :         const std::string qualify_assertions_failed =
   15862           0 :             totals.assertions.failed == totals.assertions.total() ?
   15863           0 :             bothOrAll(totals.assertions.failed) : std::string();
   15864             :         out <<
   15865           0 :             "Failed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.failed)
   15866           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15867           0 :             "failed " << qualify_assertions_failed <<
   15868           0 :             pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15869           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() == 0) {
   15870             :         out <<
   15871           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.total())
   15872           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.total(), "test case")
   15873           0 :             << " (no assertions).";
   15874           0 :     } else if (totals.assertions.failed) {
   15875           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultError);
   15876             :         out <<
   15877           0 :             "Failed " << pluralise(totals.testCases.failed, "test case") << ", "
   15878           0 :             "failed " << pluralise(totals.assertions.failed, "assertion") << '.';
   15879           0 :     } else {
   15880           0 :         Colour colour(Colour::ResultSuccess);
   15881             :         out <<
   15882           0 :             "Passed " << bothOrAll(totals.testCases.passed)
   15883           0 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") <<
   15884           0 :             " with " << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << '.';
   15885           0 :     }
   15886           0 : }
   15887             : 
   15888             : // Implementation of CompactReporter formatting
   15889             : class AssertionPrinter {
   15890             : public:
   15891             :     AssertionPrinter& operator= (AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15892             :     AssertionPrinter(AssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   15893           0 :     AssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   15894           0 :         : stream(_stream)
   15895           0 :         , result(_stats.assertionResult)
   15896           0 :         , messages(_stats.infoMessages)
   15897           0 :         , itMessage(_stats.infoMessages.begin())

   15899             : 
   15900           0 :     void print() {
   15901           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   15902             : 
   15903           0 :         itMessage = messages.begin();
   15904             : 
   15905           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   15906           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   15907           0 :             printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, passedString());
   15908           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15909           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15910           0 :             if (!result.hasExpression())
   15911           0 :                 printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15912             :             else
   15913           0 :                 printRemainingMessages();
   15914           0 :             break;
   15915           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   15916           0 :             if (result.isOk())
   15917           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::ResultSuccess, failedString() + std::string(" - but was ok"));
   15918             :             else
   15919           0 :                 printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15920           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   15921           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   15922           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15923           0 :             break;
   15924           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   15925           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15926           0 :             printIssue("unexpected exception with message:");
   15927           0 :             printMessage();
   15928           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15929           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15930           0 :             break;
   15931           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   15932           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15933           0 :             printIssue("fatal error condition with message:");
   15934           0 :             printMessage();
   15935           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15936           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15937           0 :             break;
   15938           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   15939           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15940           0 :             printIssue("expected exception, got none");
   15941           0 :             printExpressionWas();
   15942           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15943           0 :             break;
   15944           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   15945           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "info");
   15946           0 :             printMessage();
   15947           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15948           0 :             break;
   15949           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   15950           0 :             printResultType(Colour::None, "warning");
   15951           0 :             printMessage();
   15952           0 :             printRemainingMessages();
   15953           0 :             break;
   15954           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   15955           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, failedString());
   15956           0 :             printIssue("explicitly");
   15957           0 :             printRemainingMessages(Colour::None);
   15958           0 :             break;
   15959             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   15960           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   15961             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   15962             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   15963           0 :             printResultType(Colour::Error, "** internal error **");
   15964           0 :             break;
   15965             :         }
   15966           0 :     }

   15988           0 :     void printExpressionWas() {
   15989           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   15990           0 :             stream << ';';
   15991             :             {
   15992           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());

   15999           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {

   16001           0 :             stream << ' ' << result.getExpression();

   16003           0 :     }
   16004             : 
   16005           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   16006           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   16007             :             {
   16008           0 :                 Colour colour(dimColour());
   16009           0 :                 stream << " for: ";

   16013           0 :     }
   16014             : 
   16015           0 :     void printMessage() {
   16016           0 :         if (itMessage != messages.end()) {
   16017           0 :             stream << " '" << itMessage->message << '\'';
   16018           0 :             ++itMessage;
   16019             :         }
   16020           0 :     }
   16021             : 
   16022           0 :     void printRemainingMessages(Colour::Code colour = dimColour()) {
   16023           0 :         if (itMessage == messages.end())
   16024           0 :             return;
   16025             : 
   16026           0 :         const auto itEnd = messages.cend();
   16027           0 :         const auto N = static_cast<std::size_t>(std::distance(itMessage, itEnd));
   16028             : 
   16029             :         {
   16030           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   16031           0 :             stream << " with " << pluralise(N, "message") << ':';
   16032           0 :         }
   16033             : 
   16034           0 :         while (itMessage != itEnd) {
   16035             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   16036           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || itMessage->type != ResultWas::Info) {
   16037           0 :                 printMessage();
   16038           0 :                 if (itMessage != itEnd) {
   16039           0 :                     Colour colourGuard(dimColour());
   16040           0 :                     stream << " and";
   16041           0 :                 }
   16042           0 :                 continue;
   16043           0 :             }
   16044           0 :             ++itMessage;
   16045             :         }
   16046             :     }

   16127             : // Formatter impl for ConsoleReporter
   16128             : class ConsoleAssertionPrinter {
   16129             : public:
   16130             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter& operator= (ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   16131             :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(ConsoleAssertionPrinter const&) = delete;
   16132           0 :     ConsoleAssertionPrinter(std::ostream& _stream, AssertionStats const& _stats, bool _printInfoMessages)
   16133           0 :         : stream(_stream),
   16134           0 :         stats(_stats),
   16135           0 :         result(_stats.assertionResult),
   16136           0 :         colour(Colour::None),
   16137           0 :         message(result.getMessage()),
   16138           0 :         messages(_stats.infoMessages),
   16139           0 :         printInfoMessages(_printInfoMessages) {
   16140           0 :         switch (result.getResultType()) {
   16141           0 :         case ResultWas::Ok:
   16142           0 :             colour = Colour::Success;
   16143           0 :             passOrFail = "PASSED";
   16144             :             //if( result.hasMessage() )
   16145           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   16146           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   16147           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   16148           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   16149           0 :             break;
   16150           0 :         case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   16151           0 :             if (result.isOk()) {
   16152           0 :                 colour = Colour::Success;
   16153           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED - but was ok";
   16154             :             } else {
   16155           0 :                 colour = Colour::Error;
   16156           0 :                 passOrFail = "FAILED";
   16157             :             }
   16158           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   16159           0 :                 messageLabel = "with message";
   16160           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   16161           0 :                 messageLabel = "with messages";
   16162           0 :             break;
   16163           0 :         case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   16164           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   16165           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   16166           0 :             messageLabel = "due to unexpected exception with ";
   16167           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   16168           0 :                 messageLabel += "message";
   16169           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   16170           0 :                 messageLabel += "messages";
   16171           0 :             break;
   16172           0 :         case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   16173           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   16174           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   16175           0 :             messageLabel = "due to a fatal error condition";
   16176           0 :             break;
   16177           0 :         case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   16178           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   16179           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   16180           0 :             messageLabel = "because no exception was thrown where one was expected";
   16181           0 :             break;
   16182           0 :         case ResultWas::Info:
   16183           0 :             messageLabel = "info";
   16184           0 :             break;
   16185           0 :         case ResultWas::Warning:
   16186           0 :             messageLabel = "warning";
   16187           0 :             break;
   16188           0 :         case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   16189           0 :             passOrFail = "FAILED";
   16190           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   16191           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() == 1)
   16192           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with message";
   16193           0 :             if (_stats.infoMessages.size() > 1)
   16194           0 :                 messageLabel = "explicitly with messages";
   16195           0 :             break;
   16196             :             // These cases are here to prevent compiler warnings
   16197           0 :         case ResultWas::Unknown:
   16198             :         case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   16199             :         case ResultWas::Exception:
   16200           0 :             passOrFail = "** internal error **";
   16201           0 :             colour = Colour::Error;
   16202           0 :             break;
   16203             :         }
   16204           0 :     }
   16205             : 
   16206           0 :     void print() const {
   16207           0 :         printSourceInfo();
   16208           0 :         if (stats.totals.assertions.total() > 0) {
   16209           0 :             printResultType();
   16210           0 :             printOriginalExpression();
   16211           0 :             printReconstructedExpression();
   16212             :         } else {
   16213           0 :             stream << '\n';
   16214             :         }
   16215           0 :         printMessage();
   16216           0 :     }
   16217             : 
   16218             : private:
   16219           0 :     void printResultType() const {
   16220           0 :         if (!passOrFail.empty()) {
   16221           0 :             Colour colourGuard(colour);
   16222           0 :             stream << passOrFail << ":\n";
   16223           0 :         }
   16224           0 :     }
   16225           0 :     void printOriginalExpression() const {
   16226           0 :         if (result.hasExpression()) {
   16227           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::OriginalExpression);
   16228           0 :             stream << "  ";
   16229           0 :             stream << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   16230           0 :             stream << '\n';
   16231           0 :         }
   16232           0 :     }
   16233           0 :     void printReconstructedExpression() const {
   16234           0 :         if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   16235           0 :             stream << "with expansion:\n";
   16236           0 :             Colour colourGuard(Colour::ReconstructedExpression);
   16237           0 :             stream << Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';
   16238           0 :         }
   16239           0 :     }
   16240           0 :     void printMessage() const {
   16241           0 :         if (!messageLabel.empty())
   16242           0 :             stream << messageLabel << ':' << '\n';
   16243           0 :         for (auto const& msg : messages) {
   16244             :             // If this assertion is a warning ignore any INFO messages
   16245           0 :             if (printInfoMessages || msg.type != ResultWas::Info)
   16246           0 :                 stream << Column(msg.message).indent(2) << '\n';
   16247             :         }
   16248           0 :     }
   16249           0 :     void printSourceInfo() const {
   16250           0 :         Colour colourGuard(Colour::FileName);
   16251           0 :         stream << result.getSourceInfo() << ": ";
   16252           0 :     }
   16253             : 
   16254             :     std::ostream& stream;

   16262             :     bool printInfoMessages;

   16264             : 
   16265           3 : std::size_t makeRatio(std::size_t number, std::size_t total) {
   16266           3 :     std::size_t ratio = total > 0 ? CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH * number / total : 0;
   16267           3 :     return (ratio == 0 && number > 0) ? 1 : ratio;
   16268             : }
   16269             : 
   16270           1 : std::size_t& findMax(std::size_t& i, std::size_t& j, std::size_t& k) {
   16271           1 :     if (i > j && i > k)
   16272           0 :         return i;
   16273           1 :     else if (j > k)
   16274           0 :         return j;
   16275             :     else
   16276           1 :         return k;
   16277             : }
   16278             : 
   16279             : struct ColumnInfo {
   16280             :     enum Justification { Left, Right };
   16281             :     std::string name;
   16282             :     int width;
   16283             :     Justification justification;
   16284             : };
   16285             : struct ColumnBreak {};
   16286             : struct RowBreak {};
   16287             : 
   16288             : class Duration {
   16289             :     enum class Unit {
   16290             :         Auto,
   16291             :         Nanoseconds,
   16292             :         Microseconds,
   16293             :         Milliseconds,
   16294             :         Seconds,
   16295             :         Minutes
   16296             :     };
   16297             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond = 1000;
   16298             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond;
   16299             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInASecond = 1000 * s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond;
   16300             :     static const uint64_t s_nanosecondsInAMinute = 60 * s_nanosecondsInASecond;
   16301             : 
   16302             :     double m_inNanoseconds;
   16303             :     Unit m_units;
   16304             : 
   16305             : public:
   16306             :     explicit Duration(double inNanoseconds, Unit units = Unit::Auto)
   16307             :         : m_inNanoseconds(inNanoseconds),
   16308             :         m_units(units) {
   16309             :         if (m_units == Unit::Auto) {
   16310             :             if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond)
   16311             :                 m_units = Unit::Nanoseconds;
   16312             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond)
   16313             :                 m_units = Unit::Microseconds;
   16314             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInASecond)
   16315             :                 m_units = Unit::Milliseconds;
   16316             :             else if (m_inNanoseconds < s_nanosecondsInAMinute)
   16317             :                 m_units = Unit::Seconds;
   16318             :             else
   16319             :                 m_units = Unit::Minutes;
   16320             :         }
   16321             : 
   16322             :     }
   16323             : 
   16324             :     auto value() const -> double {
   16325             :         switch (m_units) {
   16326             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   16327             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMicrosecond);
   16328             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   16329             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMillisecond);
   16330             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   16331             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInASecond);
   16332             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   16333             :             return m_inNanoseconds / static_cast<double>(s_nanosecondsInAMinute);
   16334             :         default:
   16335             :             return m_inNanoseconds;
   16336             :         }
   16337             :     }
   16338             :     auto unitsAsString() const -> std::string {
   16339             :         switch (m_units) {
   16340             :         case Unit::Nanoseconds:
   16341             :             return "ns";
   16342             :         case Unit::Microseconds:
   16343             :             return "us";
   16344             :         case Unit::Milliseconds:
   16345             :             return "ms";
   16346             :         case Unit::Seconds:
   16347             :             return "s";
   16348             :         case Unit::Minutes:
   16349             :             return "m";
   16350             :         default:
   16351             :             return "** internal error **";
   16352             :         }
   16353             : 
   16354             :     }
   16355             :     friend auto operator << (std::ostream& os, Duration const& duration) -> std::ostream& {
   16356             :         return os << duration.value() << ' ' << duration.unitsAsString();
   16357             :     }
   16358             : };
   16359             : } // end anon namespace

   16699           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotals( Totals const& totals ) {

   16701           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "No tests ran\n";
   16702           1 :     } else if (totals.assertions.total() > 0 && totals.testCases.allPassed()) {

   16704           1 :         stream << " ("
   16705           2 :             << pluralise(totals.assertions.passed, "assertion") << " in "
   16706           2 :             << pluralise(totals.testCases.passed, "test case") << ')'
   16707           1 :             << '\n';
   16708             :     } else {
   16709             : 
   16710           0 :         std::vector<SummaryColumn> columns;

   16719           0 :                           .addRow(totals.assertions.failed));

   16724           0 :         printSummaryRow("test cases", columns, 0);
   16725           0 :         printSummaryRow("assertions", columns, 1);

   16727           1 : }
   16728           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryRow(std::string const& label, std::vector<SummaryColumn> const& cols, std::size_t row) {

   16733           0 :             if (value != "0")
   16734           0 :                 stream << value;
   16735             :             else
   16736           0 :                 stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << "- none -";
   16737           0 :         } else if (value != "0") {
   16738           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::LightGrey) << " | ";
   16739           0 :             stream << Colour(col.colour)

   16745             : 
   16746           1 : void ConsoleReporter::printTotalsDivider(Totals const& totals) {
   16747           1 :     if (totals.testCases.total() > 0) {
   16748           1 :         std::size_t failedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failed, totals.testCases.total());
   16749           1 :         std::size_t failedButOkRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.failedButOk, totals.testCases.total());
   16750           1 :         std::size_t passedRatio = makeRatio(totals.testCases.passed, totals.testCases.total());
   16751           1 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio < CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   16752           0 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)++;
   16753           2 :         while (failedRatio + failedButOkRatio + passedRatio > CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1)
   16754           1 :             findMax(failedRatio, failedButOkRatio, passedRatio)--;
   16755             : 
   16756           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Error) << std::string(failedRatio, '=');
   16757           1 :         stream << Colour(Colour::ResultExpectedFailure) << std::string(failedButOkRatio, '=');
   16758           1 :         if (totals.testCases.allPassed())
   16759           1 :             stream << Colour(Colour::ResultSuccess) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   16760             :         else
   16761           0 :             stream << Colour(Colour::Success) << std::string(passedRatio, '=');
   16762             :     } else {
   16763           0 :         stream << Colour(Colour::Warning) << std::string(CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - 1, '=');
   16764             :     }
   16765           1 :     stream << '\n';
   16766           1 : }
   16767           0 : void ConsoleReporter::printSummaryDivider() {
   16768           0 :     stream << getLineOfChars<'-'>() << '\n';
   16769           0 : }

   16801           0 :         std::string getCurrentTimestamp() {
   16802             :             // Beware, this is not reentrant because of backward compatibility issues
   16803             :             // Also, UTC only, again because of backward compatibility (%z is C++11)
   16804             :             time_t rawtime;
   16805           0 :             std::time(&rawtime);
   16806           0 :             auto const timeStampSize = sizeof("2017-01-16T17:06:45Z");
   16807             : 
   16808             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   16809             :             std::tm timeInfo = {};
   16810             :             gmtime_s(&timeInfo, &rawtime);
   16811             : #else
   16812             :             std::tm* timeInfo;
   16813           0 :             timeInfo = std::gmtime(&rawtime);
   16814             : #endif
   16815             : 
   16816             :             char timeStamp[timeStampSize];
   16817           0 :             const char * const fmt = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ";
   16818             : 
   16819             : #ifdef _MSC_VER
   16820             :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, &timeInfo);
   16821             : #else
   16822           0 :             std::strftime(timeStamp, timeStampSize, fmt, timeInfo);
   16823             : #endif
   16824           0 :             return std::string(timeStamp, timeStampSize-1);
   16825             :         }
   16826             : 
   16827           0 :         std::string fileNameTag(const std::vector<std::string> &tags) {
   16828           0 :             auto it = std::find_if(begin(tags),
   16829             :                                    end(tags),
   16830           0 :                                    [] (std::string const& tag) {return tag.front() == '#'; });
   16831           0 :             if (it != tags.end())
   16832           0 :                 return it->substr(1);
   16833           0 :             return std::string();
   16834             :         }
   16835             : 
   16836             :         // Formats the duration in seconds to 3 decimal places.
   16837             :         // This is done because some genius defined Maven Surefire schema
   16838             :         // in a way that only accepts 3 decimal places, and tools like
   16839             :         // Jenkins use that schema for validation JUnit reporter output.
   16840           0 :         std::string formatDuration( double seconds ) {
   16841           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   16842           0 :             rss << std::fixed << std::setprecision( 3 ) << seconds;
   16843           0 :             return rss.str();
   16844           0 :         }
   16845             :

   16903           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeGroup( TestGroupNode const& groupNode, double suiteTime ) {
   16904           0 :         XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( "testsuite" );
   16905             :

   16941           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeTestCase( TestCaseNode const& testCaseNode ) {
   16942           0 :         TestCaseStats const& stats = testCaseNode.value;
   16943             : 
   16944             :         // All test cases have exactly one section - which represents the
   16945             :         // test case itself. That section may have 0-n nested sections
   16946           0 :         assert( testCaseNode.children.size() == 1 );
   16947           0 :         SectionNode const& rootSection = *testCaseNode.children.front();
   16948             : 
   16949           0 :         std::string className = stats.testInfo.className;
   16950             : 
   16951           0 :         if( className.empty() ) {
   16952           0 :             className = fileNameTag(stats.testInfo.tags);
   16953           0 :             if ( className.empty() )
   16954           0 :                 className = "global";
   16955             :         }
   16956             : 
   16957           0 :         if ( !m_config->name().empty() )
   16958           0 :             className = m_config->name() + "." + className;
   16959             : 
   16960           0 :         writeSection( className, "", rootSection, stats.testInfo.okToFail() );
   16961           0 :     }
   16962             : 
   16963           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeSection( std::string const& className,
   16964             :                                       std::string const& rootName,
   16965             :                                       SectionNode const& sectionNode,
   16966             :                                       bool testOkToFail) {
   16967           0 :         std::string name = trim( sectionNode.stats.sectionInfo.name );
   16968           0 :         if( !rootName.empty() )
   16969           0 :             name = rootName + '/' + name;
   16970             : 
   16971           0 :         if( !sectionNode.assertions.empty() ||
   16972           0 :             !sectionNode.stdOut.empty() ||
   16973           0 :             !sectionNode.stdErr.empty() ) {
   16974           0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( "testcase" );
   16975           0 :             if( className.empty() ) {
   16976           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname", name );
   16977           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "name", "root" );
   16978             :             }
   16979             :             else {
   16980           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "classname", className );
   16981           0 :                 xml.writeAttribute( "name", name );
   16982             :             }
   16983           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "time", formatDuration( sectionNode.stats.durationInSeconds ) );
   16984             :             // This is not ideal, but it should be enough to mimic gtest's
   16985             :             // junit output.
   16986             :             // Ideally the JUnit reporter would also handle `skipTest`
   16987             :             // events and write those out appropriately.
   16988           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "status", "run" );
   16989             : 
   16990           0 :             if (sectionNode.stats.assertions.failedButOk) {
   16991           0 :                 xml.scopedElement("skipped")
   16992           0 :                     .writeAttribute("message", "TEST_CASE tagged with !mayfail");
   16993             :             }
   16994             : 
   16995           0 :             writeAssertions( sectionNode );
   16996             : 
   16997           0 :             if( !sectionNode.stdOut.empty() )
   16998           0 :                 xml.scopedElement( "system-out" ).writeText( trim( sectionNode.stdOut ), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   16999           0 :             if( !sectionNode.stdErr.empty() )
   17000           0 :                 xml.scopedElement( "system-err" ).writeText( trim( sectionNode.stdErr ), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   17001           0 :         }
   17002           0 :         for( auto const& childNode : sectionNode.childSections )
   17003           0 :             if( className.empty() )
   17004           0 :                 writeSection( name, "", *childNode, testOkToFail );
   17005             :             else
   17006           0 :                 writeSection( className, name, *childNode, testOkToFail );
   17007           0 :     }
   17008             : 
   17009           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertions( SectionNode const& sectionNode ) {
   17010           0 :         for( auto const& assertion : sectionNode.assertions )
   17011           0 :             writeAssertion( assertion );
   17012           0 :     }
   17013             : 
   17014           0 :     void JunitReporter::writeAssertion( AssertionStats const& stats ) {
   17015           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = stats.assertionResult;
   17016           0 :         if( !result.isOk() ) {
   17017           0 :             std::string elementName;
   17018           0 :             switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   17019           0 :                 case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   17020             :                 case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   17021           0 :                     elementName = "error";
   17022           0 :                     break;
   17023           0 :                 case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   17024             :                 case ResultWas::ExpressionFailed:
   17025             :                 case ResultWas::DidntThrowException:
   17026           0 :                     elementName = "failure";
   17027           0 :                     break;
   17028             : 
   17029             :                 // We should never see these here:
   17030           0 :                 case ResultWas::Info:
   17031             :                 case ResultWas::Warning:
   17032             :                 case ResultWas::Ok:
   17033             :                 case ResultWas::Unknown:
   17034             :                 case ResultWas::FailureBit:
   17035             :                 case ResultWas::Exception:
   17036           0 :                     elementName = "internalError";
   17037           0 :                     break;
   17038             :             }
   17039             : 
   17040           0 :             XmlWriter::ScopedElement e = xml.scopedElement( elementName );
   17041             : 
   17042           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "message", result.getExpression() );
   17043           0 :             xml.writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   17044             : 
   17045           0 :             ReusableStringStream rss;
   17046           0 :             if (stats.totals.assertions.total() > 0) {
   17047           0 :                 rss << "FAILED" << ":\n";
   17048           0 :                 if (result.hasExpression()) {
   17049           0 :                     rss << "  ";
   17050           0 :                     rss << result.getExpressionInMacro();
   17051           0 :                     rss << '\n';
   17052             :                 }
   17053           0 :                 if (result.hasExpandedExpression()) {
   17054           0 :                     rss << "with expansion:\n";
   17055           0 :                     rss << Column(result.getExpandedExpression()).indent(2) << '\n';
   17056             :                 }
   17057             :             } else {
   17058           0 :                 rss << '\n';
   17059             :             }
   17060             : 
   17061           0 :             if( !result.getMessage().empty() )
   17062           0 :                 rss << result.getMessage() << '\n';
   17063           0 :             for( auto const& msg : stats.infoMessages )
   17064           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info )
   17065           0 :                     rss << msg.message << '\n';
   17066             : 
   17067           0 :             rss << "at " << result.getSourceInfo();
   17068           0 :             xml.writeText( rss.str(), XmlFormatting::Newline );
   17069           0 :         }
   17070           0 :     }

   17316           0 :     bool XmlReporter::assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) {
   17317             : 
   17318           0 :         AssertionResult const& result = assertionStats.assertionResult;
   17319             : 
   17320           0 :         bool includeResults = m_config->includeSuccessfulResults() || !result.isOk();
   17321             : 
   17322           0 :         if( includeResults || result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   17323             :             // Print any info messages in <Info> tags.
   17324           0 :             for( auto const& msg : assertionStats.infoMessages ) {
   17325           0 :                 if( msg.type == ResultWas::Info && includeResults ) {
   17326           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   17327           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   17328           0 :                 } else if ( msg.type == ResultWas::Warning ) {
   17329           0 :                     m_xml.scopedElement( "Warning" )
   17330           0 :                             .writeText( msg.message );
   17331             :                 }
   17332             :             }
   17333             :         }
   17334             : 
   17335             :         // Drop out if result was successful but we're not printing them.
   17336           0 :         if( !includeResults && result.getResultType() != ResultWas::Warning )
   17337           0 :             return true;
   17338             : 
   17339             :         // Print the expression if there is one.
   17340           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() ) {
   17341           0 :             m_xml.startElement( "Expression" )
   17342           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "success", result.succeeded() )
   17343           0 :                 .writeAttribute( "type", result.getTestMacroName() );
   17344             : 
   17345           0 :             writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   17346             : 
   17347           0 :             m_xml.scopedElement( "Original" )
   17348           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpression() );
   17349           0 :             m_xml.scopedElement( "Expanded" )
   17350           0 :                 .writeText( result.getExpandedExpression() );
   17351             :         }
   17352             : 
   17353             :         // And... Print a result applicable to each result type.
   17354           0 :         switch( result.getResultType() ) {
   17355           0 :             case ResultWas::ThrewException:
   17356           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Exception" );
   17357           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   17358           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   17359           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   17360           0 :                 break;
   17361           0 :             case ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition:
   17362           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "FatalErrorCondition" );
   17363           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   17364           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   17365           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   17366           0 :                 break;
   17367           0 :             case ResultWas::Info:
   17368           0 :                 m_xml.scopedElement( "Info" )
   17369           0 :                     .writeText( result.getMessage() );
   17370           0 :                 break;
   17371           0 :             case ResultWas::Warning:
   17372             :                 // Warning will already have been written
   17373           0 :                 break;
   17374           0 :             case ResultWas::ExplicitFailure:
   17375           0 :                 m_xml.startElement( "Failure" );
   17376           0 :                 writeSourceInfo( result.getSourceInfo() );
   17377           0 :                 m_xml.writeText( result.getMessage() );
   17378           0 :                 m_xml.endElement();
   17379           0 :                 break;
   17380           0 :             default:
   17381           0 :                 break;
   17382             :         }
   17383             : 
   17384           0 :         if( result.hasExpression() )
   17385           0 :             m_xml.endElement();
   17386             : 
   17387           0 :         return true;
   17388             :     }
